headings: Organizational Psychology and Human Resources M.S.
Become a dynamic leader in the modern workforce.
Admission Requirements, Degree Plan and Courses
M.S. in Organizational Psychology and Human Resources
What Can You Do With an Industrial Psychology and HR Degree?
Why Earn My Industrial Psychology and HR Degree at Angelo State?
paragraphs: Industrial psychology and human resources are growing fields that feature a wide variety of career opportunities. In our immersive degree program, you will develop your human resource and consulting skills by focusing on the study of psychological principles in the workplace. You will also gain the knowledge and skills you need to be an innovative leader in today’s multi-generation, multicultural and highly technological workforce.
Our degree program is offered 100% online. It is also a coursework-only program that does not require a thesis or internship, and you can complete your degree in as little as one year.

Our experienced faculty are partners with our students. This new degree plan has been adapted to meet the needs of the modern workforce. Our professors are excited to bring the latest principles of corporate psychology and human resources to you through this dynamic online program.
Tuition & FeesWe don’t sacrifice quality for affordability. Angelo State is committed to helping you achieve your educational goals with as little debt as possible.

ASU Distinguished Graduate ScholarshipsEarn our premier graduate scholarship based on your highest degree GPA. Once you are admitted to an ASU graduate program, you will automatically be considered. No application is necessary.
General ScholarshipsWe offer over 600 different types of scholarships. You can apply for both our general scholarships and degree-specific scholarships with one application.

The U.S. Bureau of Labor Statistics reports that employment opportunities for human resources managers, organizational consultants, and training and development managers are expected to increase significantly through 2028, adding thousands of new jobs.

Our graduates are prepared to work effectively in virtually any organizational setting, including public and nonprofit agencies, government institutions, companies and corporations, medical facilities, educational institutions, consulting firms and foundations.

Whether you’re interested in research and data analysis, developing and delivering training and education programs, corporate efficiency and safety, hiring policies, the multicultural workforce or general human resources, our comprehensive selection of courses has you covered. Our online degree program also allows you to earn your degree while continuing to fulfill any work or family obligations.

We took our previous M.S. in industrial/organizational psychology degree program that had already gained national recognition, and revamped it to offer a more contemporary approach to the psychology of today’s workplace. Organizations need professionals who can address the complex challenges of building and maintaining workplace systems and policies that will keep them competitive. Our new degree stresses organizational and human resources psychology to prepare our graduates to be those dynamic leaders in the modern workforce.

Whether you’re pursuing a master’s degree, doctoral degree or certificate/certification, you have access to all the services in ourCollege of Graduate Studies and Research. You’ll find information and resources for everything from registering for classes and writing a thesis – to available graduate/teaching assistantships and graduate research opportunities.
If you want to go fast, go alone. But if you want to go far, go together.
